Module it.polimi.ingsw

Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.charactercards

package it.polimi.ingsw.model.charactercards
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    it.polimi.ingsw.model
     
  • Class
    Description
    ArrayListStringCard
    Defines a generic Character Card that needs an ArrayList of String as a parameter.
    Bard
    Allows the player to switch from 0 to 2 students between the hall and the dining room.
    Centaur
    Allows the player to trigger a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which does not count into the influence the towers' effect.
    Flagman
    Allows the player to call the islandConquerCheck method on a selected island.
    Healer
    Allows the player to put a veto tile on a chosen island: this means that if Mother Nature reaches an island with such a tile, no conquering check method will be called.
    Innkeeper
    Allows the player to call a special version of the profCheck method, which reassigns the professor even if the current player has the same amount of students of the same color of the current owner of the professor.
    IntCard
    Defines a generic Character Card that needs an int as a parameter.
    Jester
    Allows the player to switch from 0 to 3 students between the hall and the students on the card.
    Knight
    Allows the player to call a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which gives them an extra two points of influence.
    Monk
    Allows the player to move a specified student from the card to a specified island.
    Postman
    Allows the player to move Mother Nature of up to two more spaces than of the ones specified by the Assistant Card played.
    Princess
    Allows the player to move a specified student from the card to the appropriate table.
    StringCard
    Defines a generic Character Card that needs a String as a parameter.
    StringIntCard
    Defines a generic Character Card that needs a String and an int as parameters.
    StudentsCard
    Defines a generic Character Card that has students on itself.
    Thief
    Once given a (existing) color, the game steals from every player 3 students of that color, and puts them back into the students' bag.
    Villager
    Allows the player to call a special version of the islandConquerCheck method, which allows them to take a chosen color out of the regular influence algorithm.
